The Department of Microbiology at the University of Washington is seeking candidates with postdoctoral experience for a tenure track faculty position at the Assistant Professor level. Candidates should be prepared to develop an independent research program using the tools of genetics and molecular biology to investigate current problems in prokaryotic microbiology. Research areas of special interest include bacterial pathogenesis and mechanisms of host-parasite interactions, bacterial physiology, and microbial genetics. The appointee will be expected to teach in undergraduate and graduate courses and supervise graduate students. body_text.text: The Program in Molecular and Cell Biology at the Oklahoma Medical Research Foundation invites applications for staff positions available immediately. Preference will be given to junior (Assistant Member) applicants, but applicants for more senior (Associate Member) positions will be considered. All applicants will have completed postdoctoral training with a record of research accomplishments, and should be prepared to develop strong, independent research programs combining molecular biological with genetic, biochemical, or structural approaches to basic biological problems.
body_text.section: STAFF POSITIONS IN MOLECULAR & CELL BIOLOGY

body_text.text: Research areas are flexible, the specific interests of the applicants being subordinate to their potential as investigators; The following research areas are currently represented in the program: The structural and regulatory biology of conjugal DNA transfer in prokaryotic cells (Dr. Philip Silverman), the regulation of motility and differentiation in the eukaryotic microorganism Dictyostelium discoidem (Dr. Margaret Clarke), the genetic control of neurotransmitter synthesis and neural differentiation in the nematode C. elegans (Dr. James Rand), the molecular basis of meiotic chromosome behavior in yeast and mammalian cells (Dr. Michael Dresser), and the mechanism and regulation of eukaryotic mRNA synthesis (Drs. Ron and Joan Conaway).
body_text.section: STAFF POSITIONS IN MOLECULAR & CELL BIOLOGY

body_text.text: The OMRF maintains an environment optimal for research. The Foundation offers competitive, hard money salaries; a discretionary research allocation for each laboratory; and unusually good scientific and administrative services. The Molecular and Cell Biology Program, eventually to include eight laboratories, is housed in new facilities organized to provide every aid and advantage to investigators in the early stages of their research careers. Generous startup funds, items of large equipment, technician (or postdoctoral) salary, consumable supplies, and kitchen and secretarial services are all at hand. Successful applicants will be expected presently to supplement OMRF support with extramural funding.
